{"step_by_step_thinking": "A working mother does not inherently put an infant at high risk. Being the third child also does not inherently put an infant at high risk. Twins can be considered high risk due to potential complications during pregnancy and delivery, but the highest risk factor here is antenatal preeclampsia. Preeclampsia is a pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and signs of damage to another organ system, often the liver and kidneys. It can lead to serious, even fatal, complications for both mother and baby.", "answer_choice": "B"}
